context_bundle.summary: Developmental psychology: Piaget's stages, Vygotsky's sociocultural theory, attachment theory (Bowlby/Ainsworth), Erikson's psychosocial stages, adolescent brain development, lifespan perspective.

onboarding.quick_start: Development is stage-like AND continuous. Early attachment shapes internal working models. Adolescent prefrontal cortex still developing (risk-taking). Development continues through adulthood.
common_patterns: Attachment: Secure, anxious-ambivalent, avoidant, disorganized. Internal working models persist
Adolescence: Prefrontal maturation lags limbic - emotional intensity, risk-taking, peer sensitivity
Erikson: Trust vs mistrust → Integrity vs despair. Each stage builds on resolution of previous
known_errors: Rigid stage thinking - development is messier than clean stages suggest
Critical period determinism - plasticity exists throughout lifespan
Assuming attachment is destiny - earned security is possible
Ignoring cultural variation - WEIRD developmental norms aren't universal
